data.title: KR20000067090A - manufacturing method of titanium dioxide powder for photocatalyst - Google Patents
data.meta_description: PURPOSE: A production method of anatase type TiO2 photocatalyst using meta-titanate as starting material is provided to reduce the manufacturing costs by substituting titanium alkoxide. The resultant TiO2 has high photokinesis so that it is widely used to photolysis of trichloroethane in environmental fields. CONSTITUTION: The method comprises the steps of (i) washing meta-titanate, TiO(OH)2; (ii) adjusting it by alkali solution to be pH 7-9, which is an essential step for preparing TiO2 powders; (iii) washing it with water to remove formed salts, (NH4)2SO4; (iv) adding thereto 0.01-1 pts.wt.(based on TiO2 ) of at least one compound selected from Fe2O3, ZnO, AgO and Cr2O3, spray-drying; (v) calcining it at 300-800Â°C for 1-5 hrs. The resultant anatase type TiO2 powders are characterized by having 90-110 mÂ¬2 specific surface area, up to 100 nm of average particle size, and 97% or higher purity.

The autotitration system is designed to measure the degree of decomposition reaction of a target substance by measuring the H + produced by the decomposition of DCA, a target substance during light irradiation. As a light source, Xen lamp (Xe) which has the spectrum most similar to sunlight is used. The pH-stat device is composed of Metrohm Impul-somat, pH meter, and Dosimat. As a reactor for the photolysis reaction, transparent quartz was made to order. The magnetic bar was placed in the reactor and stirred, and the slurry was continuously supplied with O 2 gas during the photolysis experiment. A 0.01 N concentration of NaOH solution was used for the addition of the autotitrator so that the 1 mM DCA solution at the concentration of decomposition was maintained at pH 3 during photolysis. A pH meter electrode was immersed in the photoreactor and the amount of OH added by Dosimat was measured to maintain pH 3 by measuring the H + produced during DCA decomposition every 10 seconds according to the pH change of the slurry.
